params.chains: A list of chains and their new permission status & rate limits. Rate limits are only used when the chain is being added through `allowed` being true.

returns._0: true if the pool can accept liquidity, false otherwise.
true is enabled, false if not.

getRemotePool(uint64).details: To support non-evm chains, this value is encoded into bytes

getRemoteToken(uint64).details: To support non-evm chains, this value is encoded into bytes

params.remoteChainSelector: The selector of the remote chain.

returns._0: true if the given chain is a permissioned remote chain.
true if the token is supported by the pool.

lockOrBurn((bytes,uint64,address,uint256.details: The whenNotCursed check is important to ensure that even if a ramp is compromised we're able to stop token movement via RMN.

params.amount: The amount of liquidity to provide.

releaseOrMint((bytes,uint64,address,uint.details: The whenNotCursed check is important to ensure that even if a ramp is compromised we're able to stop token movement via RMN.

setChainRateLimiterConfig(uint64,(bool,u.details: Only callable by the owner or the rate limiter admin. NOTE: overwrites the normal onlyAdmin check in the base implementation to also allow the rate limiter admin.

params.inboundConfig: The new inbound rate limiter config.
params.outboundConfig: The new outbound rate limiter config.
params.remoteChainSelector: The remote chain selector for which the rate limits apply.

params.prevPool: The address of the previous pool. Can be zero to have the pool act as a normal pool instead of a proxy.

setRateLimitAdmin(address).details: Only callable by the owner.Can be zero to indicate no rate limiter admin is set.

params.rateLimitAdmin: The new rate limiter admin address.

setRebalancer(address).details: Only callable by the owner.Can be zero to indicate no rebalancer is set.

params.remoteChainSelector: The remote chain selector for which the remote pool address is being set.
params.remotePoolAddress: The address of the remote pool.

params.amount: The amount of liquidity to remove.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

applyAllowListUpdates(address[],address[.notice: Apply updates to the allow list.

applyChainUpdates((uint64,bool,bytes,byt.notice: Sets the permissions for a list of chains selectors. Actual senders for these chains need to be allowed on the Router to interact with this pool.

canAcceptLiquidity().notice: Checks if the pool can accept liquidity.

getAllowListEnabled().notice: Gets whether the allowList functionality is enabled.

getCurrentInboundRateLimiterState(uint64.notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getCurrentOutboundRateLimiterState(uint6.notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getOnRamp(uint64).notice: Legacy fallback for the 1.4 token pools.

getRateLimitAdmin().notice: Gets the rate limiter admin address.

getRebalancer().notice: Gets LiquidityManager, can be address(0) if none is configured.

getRemotePool(uint64).notice: Gets the pool address on the remote chain.

getRemoteToken(uint64).notice: Gets the token address on the remote chain.

getToken().notice: Gets the IERC20 token that this pool can lock or burn.

isOffRamp(uint64,address).notice: Return true if the given offRamp is a configured offRamp for the given source chain.

isSupportedChain(uint64).notice: Checks whether a remote chain is supported in the token pool.

isSupportedToken(address).notice: Returns if the token pool supports the given token.

lockOrBurn((bytes,uint64,address,uint256.notice: Locks the token in the pool

provideLiquidity(uint256).notice: Adds liquidity to the pool. The tokens should be approved first.

releaseOrMint((bytes,uint64,address,uint.notice: Release tokens from the pool to the recipient

setChainRateLimiterConfig(uint64,(bool,u.notice: Sets the rate limiter admin address.

setPreviousPool(address).notice: Configures the legacy fallback option. If the previous pool is set, this pool will act as a proxy for the legacy pool.

setRateLimitAdmin(address).notice: Sets the rate limiter admin address.

setRemotePool(uint64,bytes).notice: Sets the remote pool address for a given chain selector.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Signals which version of the pool interface is supported

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.

withdrawLiquidity(uint256).notice: Removed liquidity to the pool. The tokens will be sent to msg.sender.

documentation.text:
@dev Whether or not the pool accepts liquidity.
 External liquidity is not required when there is one canonical token deployed to a chain,
 and CCIP is facilitating mint/burn on all the other chains, in which case the invariant
 balanceOf(pool) on home chain == sum(totalSupply(mint/burn "wrapped" token) on all remote chains) should always hold

@notice The address of the rate limiter admin.
 @dev Can be address(0) if none is configured.

@notice Gets LiquidityManager, can be address(0) if none is configured.
 @return The current liquidity manager.
@notice Gets the rate limiter admin address.

@notice Checks if the pool can accept liquidity.
 @return true if the pool can accept liquidity, false otherwise.

@notice Adds liquidity to the pool. The tokens should be approved first.
 @param amount The amount of liquidity to provide.

@notice Removed liquidity to the pool. The tokens will be sent to msg.sender.
 @param amount The amount of liquidity to remove.
